events.title: Execution of Queen Marie Antoinette
events.description: Marie Antoinette, former Queen of France, was executed by guillotine during the French Revolution.
events.significance: Marked a turning point in the Revolution by symbolizing the fall of the monarchy and the rise of the French Republic.

events.title: Alabama Constitution Grants Women Limited Voting Rights
events.description: The state of Alabama granted women the right to vote on school-related issues, one of the earliest examples of women's suffrage in the United States.
events.significance: An early milestone in the American women's suffrage movement, preceding the 19th Amendment by 15 years.

events.title: Battle of the Chosin Reservoir Begins
events.description: During the Korean War, UN forces under General Douglas MacArthur faced a massive Chinese offensive at the Chosin Reservoir in North Korea.
events.significance: A significant and brutal battle that influenced the course and intensity of the Korean War.

events.title: Lech Wałęsa Elected President of Poland
events.description: Lech Wałęsa, former leader of the Solidarity movement, was elected the first democratically elected president of Poland after communist rule.
events.significance: Symbolized the end of communist control in Poland and the transition to democracy and market economy in Eastern Europe.

events.title: The Soviet Union Invades Afghanistan
events.description: Although not precisely December 9, the Soviet military intervention in Afghanistan had ongoing significant events around this date, marking the start of a decade-long conflict.
events.significance: Initiated a prolonged conflict that affected Cold War dynamics globally.
